page.title: 01General Review of the grid
page.content: The grid is primarily a farming environment. The gently rolling landscape is a patchwork of arable fields and pasture, with some woodland. Crops grown include wheat and barley, while sheep and cattle are grazed on pasture. Settlement is limited to a small number of scattered farms and houses, although the village of Barkby touches on the south-west corner, and Queniborough edges into the northern boundary of the grid. The land slopes gently from higher ground around Barkby Holt, in the south-east corner, towards the north-west. Two small streams drain the area , Queniborough Brook to the north, and Barkby Brook to the south. Both streams occupy shallow valleys and flow towards the north-west.
